Class SecretAgent

java.lang.Object
  heroAnswers.SecretAgent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Hero
public class SecretAgent
extends java.lang.Object
implements Hero

A secret agent has both a name and an alias, usually a number. In addition, secret agents have a favourite gadget.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Colin Fidge

Constructor Summary
SecretAgent(java.lang.String trueName, java.lang.String codeName, java.lang.String gadget)
          A secret agent has a civilian identity and a codename used when on a mission, as well as a number of gadgets.
 
Method Summary

          Returns the hero's current identity in a printable format.
 java.lang.String getGadget()

          Switches the hero's current identity to their alter ego.

Constructor Detail

SecretAgent

public SecretAgent(java.lang.String trueName,
                   java.lang.String codeName,
                   java.lang.String gadget)
A secret agent has a civilian identity and a codename used when on a mission, as well as a number of gadgets.

Parameters:
trueName - the secret agents's real name
codeName - the secret agent's identity within his or her organisation
gadget - the secret agent's favourite gadget
